fields.description: Immediately after starting SourceTree it crashed and opened the JIRA website and the folder with the sourcetree.log file. I attached it.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed immediately after start

fields.description:
SourceTree crashed at startup.
I can't replicate the problem.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed at startup
Update inbuilt Git to 2.5.1
Crushes Everytime
When slash is used rather than antislash in the local path when cloning repository, "Open in Explorer" won't work properly
SourceTree Crash on start

fields.description:
I have cloned xCode project from Github.
SourceTree provides errors during the cloning, error messages are 'invalid file name' or something similar error message.

The xcode project include a lot of files which has spaces and special characters such as at sign.

NOTE: About the version of SouceTree, I don't know but I believe I have installed the program about 2 months ago.
fields.summary: Keep crashing after clone a project which contains files that include space and at (@) sign.

fields.description: The dialog that pops up when clicking on Tools > Options > Authentication > Default User Names:Edit is titled "Edit Password".  This should probably be "Edit Username".
fields.summary: Incorrect title in username window

fields.description:
I have defined a custom action to load a file into an external editor (see CustomAction1.png).
This works perfect if I apply it on the File Status tab (see CustomAction2.png).
However, the action does not appear on the Log / History tab (see CustomAction3.png).
For looking at what has been done with a file using a wider scope than the build-in diff or fixing something that you see while viewing changes, this would be extremly useful.
I guess this can't be too costly, would make my everyday life much easier.
fields.summary: Custom action ($FILE) not appearing in log history

fields.description:
Git for Windows 2.5 has been officially released [1], including many new features, performance improvements and also security fixes [2-7]. Are there any plans to switch from the superseeded msysgit to the new Git for Windows?

[1]: https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/releases/tag/v2.5.0.windows.1
[2]: http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/02/whats-new-git-1-9
[3]: http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/06/happened-git-2-0-full-goodies
[4]: http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/08/whats-new-git-2-1
[5]: http://developer.atlassian.com/blog/2014/12/git-2-2-0-released
http://github.com/blog/1957-git-2-3-has-been-released
[6]: http://github.com/blog/1994-git-2-4-atomic-pushes-push-to-deploy-and-more
[7]: http://github.com/blog/2042-git-2-5-including-multiple-worktrees-and-triangular-workflows
fields.summary: Update to Git 2.5
Diff preview does not work with java files when proxy is enabled

fields.description:
When creating a release/hotfix using gitflow and finishing it with a tag, then the tag is not merged into the develop branch. It only shows up in the master branch's history.

This is especial visible in Visual Studio 2015, when you look at the branch history. The master branch tags are not visible when looking at the develop branch history. Actually it messes up the branch history so much that you don't even see where the master branch is at.
fields.summary: GitFlow - Tags are not merged into develop when finishing release or hotfix

fields.description: SourceTree crashed on startup, log attached. Attempting to start a second time was successful, although the open bookmarks from my previous session were closed.
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.6.20.0 crash on startup

fields.description:
Switching branches within a repo (via clicking branches treeview), a task which typically takes between 10-20 seconds.

Starting with the latest version (upgraded from .18) frequently the UI will simply stop refreshing. Switching to a different bookmarked repos results in infinite spinning logo. Refresh/F5 does nothing. Only solution is to restart program.

This issue may also be caused by other operations other than checking out a branch. 
This behavior has been seen rarely in older versions however in .20 this issue has occurred several times in the last two days.
fields.summary: SourceTree stops refreshing after switching branches

fields.description:
With Git 2.5.0 (64 bit), when terminal is opened, it doesn't recognize git:
!sourcetree_terminal.png|thumbnail!

On the other hand, Git Bash opened in the same directory/repo, behaves correctly:
!git_bash.png|thumbnail!

As well as Windows Command Prompt:
!cmd.png|thumbnail!

Was working fine with 1.9.5 git.
fields.summary: Terminal not recognizing Git (2.5.0) in path

fields.description:
As SourceTree continously polls the repos I have open for incoming changes, it'd be nice to see that value on the icon in the taskbar, so I don't forget to check SourceTree when beginning to implement a feature.

I'm fine with it showing only the value for the current tab, i.e. just mirror the values on the Pull/Push icons,
fields.summary: Show incoming changes for tab-open repos on icon i taskbar

fields.description:
I often need to selectively stage a few lines from a file rather than all changes. Currently I can select a few lines and then click the "Stage lines" button. If the changes are in a large hunk and they aren't in a contiguous block, then this can involve a lot of scrolling up and down due to the placement of the buttons.

It would be good if all of the stage, discard and unstage operations were available from a right-click menu in the diff viewer.
fields.summary: Right-click menu in diff viewer

fields.description:
The diff viewer only shows a limited number of changes to a file with a "..." being shown at the bottom. I often have to use an external diff tool due to this limitation. I would prefer to use the SourceTree diff as it allows for selective staging of lines and hunks which I can't do with an external diff.

As such it would be really good if there was a way to view a diff for the entire file rather than cutting off the end. Maybe allow clicking the "..." to load more of the file or something like that.
fields.summary: Show all changes in diff viewer

fields.description:
In Source Tree Log/History View, expand Remotes/origin branch:

1. Create a new branch TEST, place a unique commit on it.
2. Push to origin.
3. select remote branch TEST that is NOT merged
4. right-click on branch name in the tree view at left, select Delete, then OK.

Expectation: You will be warned that branch is not merged, because the "Force delete" check box is unchecked.
Actual: Branch is deleted and pushed.

Possibly the same as this bug, except that this occurs on Windows: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1999
fields.summary: Deleting non-merged remote branch does not require 'force delete' to be checked

fields.description: This will significantly help simplify the installation, and also to reduce the need of teaching users how to manually use newer version of Git. Also, users only need to install one packages instead of two.
fields.summary: Update Embedded Git to be more up to date.

fields.description: It's not possible to create pull requests in internal Git Repositories because it's not possible to edit "host root URL" in the "remote details" popup when choosing GitHub as a "host type"
fields.summary: Allow internal GitHub repositories be configured in order to create pull requests

fields.description:
Git for Windows v2.5.0 was [officially released|https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/releases/tag/v2.5.0.windows.1] a few days ago. After upgrading, SourceTree now crashes when I click the Terminal button (see attached stack trace).

When I try to use the Fetch, Pull, or Push buttons, SourceTree doesn't crash, but I get the following error message:

bq. error: cannot spawn C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\openssh_wrapper.sh: No such file or directory
fields.summary: Errors and crashes after upgrading Git to v2.5.0

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Open 'Log selected' on two seperate files, such that you have two Log windows open on the screen.

2) Press maximize on one of the windows

Expected: Only the window you clicked maximize on is maximized, and the windows with the focus is the one you maximized.

Actual: All open 'Log' windows get maximized, and additionally the order in which they are maximized is such that the one ending up with the focus is NOT the one you clicked maximize on.

More detail: if you have a two monitor display, you can place one Log window on each monitor. Then, clicking maximize, you can clearly see that the additional log windows are maximized automatically in sequence, and the focus is given to the wrong window. In that case, the window is not "hidden" as its on the other monitor, but still, it should not be maximized.
fields.summary: Clicking maximize on 'Log' window maximizes all open Log windows (and steals focus)

fields.description:
I have noticed since upgrading SourceTree that I can no longer remove or move or rename local repositories after using sourcetree.  This is because sourcetree is leaving behind an un killable set of processes which only a reboot will clear.

git.exe
   conhost.exe
   git.exe

e.g. Using process hacker 2

"C:\Users\Me\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\git_local\cmd\git.exe" --no-pager -c color.branch=false -c color.diff=false -c color.status=false -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false diff --unified=3 -M --cached --no-color --no-ext-diff -- src/images/leaderboard.png

Started: 2 hours and 12 minutes ago (16:05:37 19/08/2015)

PS C:\Users\Me> taskkill /im git.exe
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 9604 could not be terminated.
Reason: This process can only be terminated forcefully (with /F option).
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 8856 could not be terminated.
Reason: This process can only be terminated forcefully (with /F option).
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 9608 could not be terminated.
Reason: This process can only be terminated forcefully (with /F option).
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 5880 could not be terminated.
Reason: This process can only be terminated forcefully (with /F option).
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 5892 could not be terminated.
Reason: This process can only be terminated forcefully (with /F option).
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 240 could not be terminated.
Reason: This process can only be terminated forcefully (with /F option).

Using /F does not kill them either, giving

PS C:\Users\Me> taskkill /im git.exe /f
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 9604 could not be terminated.
Reason: There is no running instance of the task.
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 8856 could not be terminated.
Reason: There is no running instance of the task.
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 9608 could not be terminated.
Reason: There is no running instance of the task.
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 5880 could not be terminated.
Reason: There is no running instance of the task.
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 5892 could not be terminated.
Reason: There is no running instance of the task.
ERROR: The process "git.exe" with PID 240 could not be terminated.
Reason: There is no running instance of the task.

Windows 8.1
fields.summary: Atlassian\SourceTree\git_local\cmd\git.exe - stuck processes require reboot
Crash while creating pull request

fields.description: Modal window which presents information on Sourcetree is static (E.g: add/remove file messages). So if the messages are too long, it's not possible to press 'OK' to close the message, and the enter button needs to be pressed to close the message.
fields.summary: Slider needed for messages modal window on Sourcetree

fields.description: It would be nice to have an option on the output of cloning a repository to keep scrolling to the bottom showing the most recent output
fields.summary: Cloning from... screen output - Option to keep scrolling to the botton of the output

fields.description: When amending a git commit, ST shows a warning dialog about overwriting the current commit message, even if i haven't entered any message.
fields.summary: Ammend commit shows warning about overwriting current commit message when its not needed.

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
1) Make sure the option "do not fast-forward when merging" is checked on Sourcetree Options
2) Start a new feature with Git Flow, and commit into the feature branch
3) Select 'Finish Feature'
4) With the option "do not fast-forward when merging" checked, a commit should be created after finishing the feature and merging the branch, Commit doesn't seem to be created and doesn't show on the history

The commit shows if everything is done manually (via git command line)
fields.summary: Although the option "do not fast-forward when merging" option is checked, Gitflow/finish feature does not create a commit on the graph

fields.description:
As soon as I start SourceTree it crashes. The popup appears three times in quick succession. As soon as I click Report Bug or Cancel on the top popup, they all disappear.

A reinstall of the latest version (1.6.20) had no effect.

I've attached a fresh log.
fields.summary: Crashes as soon as it starts, with NullReferenceException

fields.description:
I'm looking at a commit, investigating. Having the window open and visible.
A certain file in the commit is selected, and scrolled down.
After two minutes, SourceTree "refreshes" (I guess because of a Fetch) and selects the first file so I lose focus.

This is a critical issue affecting productivity.
fields.summary: SourceTree changes the view to the first file in commit every x minutes

fields.description:
logged into windows 10 (recently upgraded from Windows 8.1)
started SourceTree. Crashed, invited me to report it here and attach log.
fields.summary: windows 10 crash

fields.description:
Finding my own issues on the "Only my issues" filter of

https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=872&projectKey=SRCTREEWIN&quickFilter=3507

and 

https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=872&projectKey=SRCTREEWIN&quickFilter=3507

fails to work.

I just posted https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-3621
In the past I posted for instance https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-2204

Both are still open.

My normal profile https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=jeroen.atlassian.com shows only a few. I'm logged in (otherwise I could not have posted this issue), but the profile page displays a bunch of useless errors (not explaining what these accounts would do, I don't think I have any of them) and then very few reports that actually matter.

Image of the errors: https://www.dropbox.com/s/7h4a5umnlq7ppn5/Screenshot%202015-08-17%2021.12.34.png?dl=0

Images of the empty lists:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/l6sy5n4sb56wz8g/Screenshot%202015-08-17%2021.13.42.png?dl=0

https://www.dropbox.com/s/taq8oon2x9vp09b/Screenshot%202015-08-17%2021.14.16.png?dl=0

Note I've not set any quickfilters myself, nor is it obvious where I could alter them (the encircled i hints it can be clicked, but hey, if these other things aren't obvious, why should this be)
fields.summary: Kanban boards don't show my old bugs, while the old boards did
Windows; .gitignore has Win32/Debug/ but 1.6.20 shows files in bin/Win32/Debug/ obj/Win32/Debug/ and lib/Win32/Debug/ whereas `git status` doesn't

fields.description:
Version 1.6.20 has fixed staging button bug, and introduced this one (though not blocking).

You put files into staged area, and then commit them. With this version, even after commit, they remain in staged area UI (list view). Yes, they get committed, but UI doesn't freshen up.

User need to browse other node, and come back to Working Copy node - and then it shows up correctly. OR when you just hit F5.
fields.summary: Files remain in Staged area (UI) even after commit

fields.description:
I commit some file then switch branch, sourcetree permit to switch don't ask about my changed. And on Confirm Branch Switch popup i don't check on Clean (discard all changes) then click OK. It switch and clear all my changed file that don't commit.

Thank you.
fields.summary: switch branch clear not commit file

fields.description:
Many issues trackers provide REST-api for list of issues. 
It will be grate if source tree help to insert issue id from such REST-services. And ST can check that commit message doesn't contains Issue-id.
fields.summary: [Dublicated. Remove] Commit message autocomplete based on issues id from someone issue tracker

fields.description:
Many issue trackers provide REST api for issues list. 
It will be great if SourceTree would help insert issue id from such REST-services. And ST could generate warning if no issue id detected in commit message.
fields.summary: Commit message autocomplete based on issues id from some issue tracker

fields.description:
SourceTree does seldom crash upon start-up.
Find attached the log.
fields.summary: SourceTree for Win 1.6.20 seldom crashes upon start-up

fields.description:
Current SourceTree version supports only commit number in hex format like 00a0a13.

It would be good to have option to show the commit number in other format like decimal 657939 (decimal format of 00a0a13)
fields.summary: Commit Number in Decimal format

fields.description:
When cloning [Ogre3D|https://bitbucket.org/sinbad/ogre/src/4578da5bf5b00fdf023b87e98099d647c5cb92ab?at=v1-9-0] and [OgreDeps|https://bitbucket.org/cabalistic/ogredeps/src] at the same time, once completed, both clone interfaces freeze up and then SourceTree reports that it crashed, and asked me to report it here.

Steps:
# Start the lengthy repo clone of Ogre3D
# While that is running, start cloning OgreDeps.
# When OgreDeps finishes, the UI is frozen except for the HG clone for Ogre3D
# When Ogre3D finishes, app freezes and reports a crash shortly after.

I'm running SourceTree 1.6.20 - the version isn't in the list, so I figured I'd type it directly here.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when cloning two Mercurial repos at the same time

fields.description: I ran Sourcetree today and was prompted to update.  I updated to the newest version, 1.6.20.  I then staged several files and clicked in the box labelled "commit message" to start typing my commit note.  It immediately crashed.  I reran the program and tried the same thing.  Again, it crashed as soon as I clicked in the Commit Message box.  My log file is attached.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes every time I start entering a comment for a commit

fields.description:
I added a new file to my repository.

The Log/History tab showed uncommitted changes, but the Unstaged files and the Staged files views were both empty.

The Staged files checkbox was checked.

I unchecked it.

SourceTree crashed.

See the attached screenshot for how SourceTree looked before I submitted the bug report.

fields.description:
It would be useful if I could copy the text from the Description column when looking at the history.  This could then be pasted into release notes to capture the changes in a release.

I'd like to be able to select a range of commit entries, and then copy/paste the list of files that changed (already able to do this), and then copy/paste the list of descriptions of the changes.
fields.summary: Ability to copy description column in Log/History tab

fields.description:
Trying to connect to Bitbucket account will be stuck at 'Checking password' if the Bitbucket account contains any large sized repos (larger at 2GB). 

Remote repos from the Bitbucket account will fail to show on the Repository Browser as well.
fields.summary: Sourcetree won't connect to Bitbucket account if account contains repos larger than 2GB

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to edit commit messages, or potential more advanced rebasing, for commits that have not been pushed.
fields.summary: Edit Commit Message

fields.description:
UPDATE 2016-06-29:  This issue still exists on Version 2.3.1 (69).

On the OS X version (1.6.2.2), the stage/discard hunk buttons are at the bottom of each hunk, buttons' background is clearly attached to the hunk above and separated from the hunk below.

In the Windows version (1.6.20), the stage/discard hunk buttons are at the top of each hunk, and the buttons' background is visually attached to both the hunk above and the hunk below.  After scrolling down so the buttons at the top of the first hunk are no longer visible, there is no way to easily tell which hunk the buttons will affect.
fields.summary: Usability: Unclear whether "Stage hunk"/"Discard hunk" buttons apply to the hunk above or below the buttons, especially after scrolling down.

fields.description: A shortcut for Garbage Collection can be handy sometimes
fields.summary: Add Git Garbage Collect (git gc) button
Bug when trying to commit many files

fields.summary: Crash while rebasing interactively

fields.description:
When manually checking for updates, I'm getting this error:
!notenoughstorage.png|thumbnail!

I've got 160GB free disk space and 8,5GB unused memory.
fields.summary: Not enough storage

fields.description: In  the code change preview window open for any unstaged/staged file, there is always a vertical scrollbar on the right. However a horizontal bar only appears when you scroll all the way down to the end of the code sample.
fields.summary: horizontal scrollbar not displayed in code preview windown

fields.description:
Users are not allowed to choose their protocol as SSH:
!https1.JPG|thumbnail!

Hence, the cloning of the repositories will always be in HTTPS:
!https2.JPG|thumbnail!

There should be at least be a function to edit the URL before cloning.

Workaround: Users can click Clone in SourceTree via Stash.
fields.summary: Improvement request: Cloning Stash repositories via SSH is not possible via SourceTree's Hosted Repositories.

fields.description: When .doc file is opened and in SourceTree is chosen discard option (press right click on file), then error message shows something like: Cannot connect server via OpenSSH control your ssha key or .....
fields.summary: Bad error message when discard changes in openned .doc file.

fields.description:
If I launch Source Tree the SSH-Agent launches also, but it closes right afterwards. So I have to add the key again and I can remove it in the settings later.

See [https://jira.atlassian.com/projects/SRCTREEWIN/issues/SRCTREEWIN-2297]
fields.summary: SSH-Agent starting and closing right afterwards

fields.description:
SourceTree v 1.6.18

I had just upgrade to windows 10

and updated sourcetree to latest version of 1.6.18

steps:
1. open source tree
2. go to left panel (project listed)
3. double click and it freeze

normally, when ever i open the sourcetree, default it will prompt my previous project
and show the latest status updates.

but this round, it didnt show anything, that why i double click on the project i want to update

Thanks.
fields.summary: Freeze when trying to pull new changes from source

fields.description: When staging files in the split view, the user can move items from top to bottom (staged to unstaged) and vice versa with the checkbox. When performing this action the view is very slow to update. Clearly the technique the software is not WPF optimized. It appears it is rebuilding an entire list/collection, resetting the ItemsSource, and/or regenerating entirely new ItemContainers. The correct way to implement views like this in WPF is to have both ItemsControls bind to the same collection and have the Visiblity toggle from collapsed to visible based on staging.
fields.summary: Split View Performance Recommendation

fields.description: If you have an unstaged file, double clicking it in source tree will raise an error. My case, I have an unstaged .js file and double clicking it raises an error.
fields.summary: Double clicking unstaged files raises an error

fields.description:
Crash on startup with a report bug window showing but no buttons just a single check box. No extra windows open at time of screenshot, when the X was clicked, a second window flashed momentarily with no content.

Tried opening a second time and SourceTree started perfectly.
marked as Major b/c not being able to report bugs makes fixing them more difficult.
fields.summary: non-normal Crash on startup
"Restart Merge" converts eol CRLF to LF

fields.description:
Staging a large number of huge sized files on Sourcetree causes staging to fail the first time, but the staging succeeds at the second attempt.

The issue still persists even after closing any other clients which may be using the files (E.g: Visual Studio)
fields.summary: Staging a large number of huge files fails on the first attempt but succeeds on the 2nd

fields.description:
Staging a large number of huge sized files on Sourcetree causes staging to fail the first time, but the staging succeeds at the second attempt.

The issue still persists even after closing any other clients which may be using the files (E.g: Visual Studio)
fields.summary: Staging a large number of huge files fails on the first attempt but succeeds on the 2nd

fields.description:
I have WinMerge setup for my external diffs. This morning I updated to the version that was offered to me, 1.6.20.

I just tried to do an external diff and nothing happened. Regardless of whether I use the Ctrl+D short cut or right click a file in my Working Copy unstaged file list, I can't get the External Diff command to do anything.

Tried restarting SourceTree and it hasn't helped.

Pretty sure this was working in the previous version, or at least the one before it.
fields.summary: External diff isn't working since upgrading to 1.6.20 on SourceTree for Windows

fields.description: When pushing changes, it would be good to select all repositories to push changes to so that all repos get the current changes.
fields.summary: Push to all repos

fields.description:
I started SourceTree v1.6.18.0 on a system where it had been working fine previously.  It crashed on startup, and the error dialog ("Oh dear. We're sorry...") came up, but was inoperable as the controls weren't all shown (see attached screenshot in Word document).

The SourceTree log file contained the following (also reported in attached DOC):

2015-08-11T14:40:52: Fatal error: 
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

2015-08-11T14:40:52: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.AppRoot.OnActivated(EventArgs e) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin\AppRoot.cs:line 340
   at System.Windows.Application.AppFilterMessage(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at MS.Win32.HwndWrapper.WndProc(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.DispatcherCallbackOperation(Object o)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: SourceTree v1.6.18.0 crashed on application launch

fields.description:
I started SourceTree v1.6.18.0 on a system where it had been working fine previously.  It crashed on startup, and the error dialog ("Oh dear. We're sorry...") came up, but was inoperable as the controls weren't all shown (see attached screenshot in Word document).

The SourceTree log file contained the following (also reported in attached DOC):
fields.summary: SourceTree v1.6.18.0 crashed on application launch

fields.description:
For an untracked file (in the git terminology), selecting a set of lines does not present the Stage Lines button:

!missing-stage-lines-button.png|thumbnail!

Note that the Stage Lines button _does_ correctly appear for tracked, modified files. This problem only occurs for untracked files.

I expect more versions than the two I noted are affected; those are just the two I've tested and reproduced on.
fields.summary: Cannot Stage Lines for untracked files

fields.description: User error.
fields.summary: DELETE ME

fields.description:
Trying to "Create Pull Request On Web" via Repository --> Create pull request...
When Show Full Output is not checked, nothing happens. When checked, it shows Completed successfully. When i click Close, the exception happens.
fields.summary: Unable to create pull request on the web

fields.description:
When committing code by hitting Ctrl+Shift+C, the buttons Stage Hunk or Stage Lines are missing. This must be a bug introduced in this version, since it worked perfectly fine yesterday when I still had the previous version.

Look at the attached screenshot to see what I mean.
fields.summary: Stage Hunk / Stage Lines not displaying

fields.description: When reordering a bookmark, when dragging it will open all folders instantly, adding a short delay before expanding a folder would improve this a lot.
fields.summary: Don't Expand Bookmark Folders Automatically

fields.description:
originally revert file from commit was not working.
but only if using revert code chunk it works anyway(behalf clicking every code chunks for revert whole file)
and now 1.6.19. the only way to revert file changes in a commit is diff to current version and correct them one to one with editor.
you guys please fix it..
fields.summary: Revert not working

fields.description: It'd be nice if I could remove columns I don't use to save on screen real estate.
fields.summary: Customizable columns

fields.description: Regression from 1.6.18 - lost Stage/Unstage Hunk/Lines buttons in diff view
fields.summary: Regression from 1.6.18 - lost Stage/Unstage Hunk/Line buttons

fields.description:
When on the Log / History tab, clicking the "..." in the upper right corner of a file in the diff view and selecting "Reverse File" causes SourceTree to crash with the following error:

2015-08-10T15:12:27: Fatal error: 
System.InvalidCastException: Unable to cast object of type 'SourceTree.Model.WindowsAwareDiffHunk' to type 'SourceTree.Model.DiffHunk'.

2015-08-10T15:12:27: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.DiffViewModel.CreatePatchFromFile(DiffFile f) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin\ViewModel\DiffViewModel.cs:line 2385
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.DiffViewModel.ReverseFile(DiffFile f) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin\ViewModel\DiffViewModel.cs:line 1763
   at System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.InvokeClickAfterRender(Object arg)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: Reverse File causes Sourcetree to crash

fields.description: When a user pins the icon for SourceTree to the Windows task bar, the icon gets deleted upon successful completion of the installer.  This forces users to recreate the icon after every update.
fields.summary: Installer deletes pinned task bar icon every time.

fields.description:
After upgrade to 1.6.19 buttons Stage Hunk/Unstage Hunk are not presented anymore.

Downgrade to 1.6.18 resolved the issue
fields.summary: Stage Hunk/Unstage Hunk buttons are not shown
"Discard selected lines" is gone (again)

fields.description: After updating to 1.6.19, "Stage hunk" and "Discard Hunks" buttons do not appear on the file diff UI anymore.
fields.summary: Cannot find "Stage hunk/lines"/"Discard hunk/lines" in UI for 1.6.19

fields.description:
Between 1.6.18 and 1.6.19 of SourceTree for Windows, the buttons that allow staging/unstaging of specific lines of a source file have disappeared. There doesn't seems to be any new equivalent functionality.

It's really important to be able to stage just certain lines of the file. This is a key reason why I use SourceTree. Please fix!
fields.summary: Buttons to stage/unstage lines have disappeared

fields.description: On the OSX version of source we have the ability to do a forced push and overwrite history.
fields.summary: Forced push checkbox like in the OSX version of SourceTree

fields.description: When running a rebase operation in SourceTree the diff windows and commit graph refresh in the background causing the creation of index.lock file that can lead to the interruption of the rebase.
fields.summary: Rebase fails sometimes because of index.lock

fields.description:
I just updated to latest SourceTree. Now, attempting to select some lines of an XML file to stage or unstage, I am not offered this facility. In previous versions, there were Unstage Lines and Stage Lines buttons, which became visible when some lines were selected.

It's really important to be able to stage/unstage just part of a file easily. It's one of the reasons that I use SourceTree over other products. Please fix!
fields.summary: Line-by-line stage/unstage buttons are no longer offered

fields.description:
After update to the latest version, the stage line / hunk buttons are missing.

All staging layouts, all views.
fields.summary: Stage hunk/lines buttons missing

fields.description:
There are some visual glitches when running SourceTree on Windows Server 2012 R2 as highlighted in the attached screenshot.

The main issue is the nodes in the graph do not line up with the rows in the commit history list.

There is also an issue where the tree expand/contract icons are slightly cut off.
fields.summary: UI defects on Windows Server 2012 R2

fields.description:
!link.PNG|thumbnail!

It would be a nice improvement if the file name could be copied from the UI to the OS clipboard.
fields.summary: make file name selectable and copyable

fields.description: !hunk.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Stage Hunk/Lines buttons are not available in the latest Sourcetree 1.6.19

fields.description:
A customer reported this bug through a support ticket.

Steps to replicate:

1. Change a source file
2. Go to SourceTree and goto the “File Status” tab and see the file is available for staging. NOTE: do not select “Unstaged files” check box yet.
3. Fill in the “Commit Message”
4. Check the box “Push changes immediately to origin/master”.
5. Check the “Unstaged files” check box to choose to stage all files
6. Quickly (as soon as the button is enabled) click the “Commit” button. If you do this operation quick enough you will see that the Source Tree application hangs and you’ll see something similar to what I captured in the attached screen shot. The only option is to kill the application, relaunch it and start the commit again.
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs when hitting Commit button too soon after checking "Unstaged files" box

fields.description:
A customer filed in a support ticket:

The UI dialog for deleting branches in SourceTree is difficult to use when dealing with large numbers of branches, as it is not possible to mass-select (via shift+highlight) branches to delete, leading one to click each individual checkbox.

A practical UX suggestion here would be to remove the checkboxes and use highlighting the box as a selection method.
fields.summary: Improvement request: To mass-select (shift+highlight) branches to be deleted, instead of clicking checkboxes one by one.

fields.description: Same crashing was happening prior to last upgrade so I listed two version above. Log attached per popup after crash.
fields.summary: Crashed, again.

fields.description:
A few customers got a crash dialog message that is almost non functional:

!crash.png|thumbnail!

The instructions says to "click the 'Report Bug' button below", but there is no "Report Bug" button on the window
fields.summary: Crash dialog screen's button does not exist, and checkbox beside a blank message.

fields.description: I had a bunch of changed files which I wanted to discard. In the 'File Status', in the 'Unstaged Files' section, I selected 2 files, right clicked and discarded them. After that, the display refreshed in 2-3 seconds and showed me the rest of the files. I then selected 4 more files which I wanted to discard and right-clicked on it. SourceTree crashed!
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed on trying to discard multiple files

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Clone a repository from remote (eg. Bitbucket) as a normal local repository.
2. Clone that same remote repository into a super-project as a submodule.
3. Open up the submodule in a new tab
- Also ensure that SourceTree checks remote for updates every x minute.
4. Make a new commit in remote repository.
5. Observe the results

Results:

#1 The local repository tab immediately notified the changes in the remote repository.

#2 The super-project tab notified that the remote has some changes in less than a minute or so.

#3 The submodule tab sort-of notified the changes after a few minutes, but it couldn't trace the changes made - i.e. the Pull button at the top notifying the number of changes made in remote without actually showing what changes - unlike the local repository tab. (Unless I click F5 to refresh, then it'll show).

Conclusion:
The submodule tab could not show the changes done despite knowing that there is changes made in remote, and even that takes quite a while to notify.
fields.summary: The submodule tab does not fully refresh once changes is made in the remote repository.

fields.description:
SourceTree 1.6.18 crashes every time I try to create a pull request on Stash. Has occurred since upgrading to 1.6.18.

+Steps+:
# In SourceTree I right click on a remote branch and select 'Create pull request'
*Result*: SourceTree instantly crashes
*Expected*: A pull request is opened on Stash

Stack trace in log:

{quote}2015-08-07T13:06:28: Stack trace: 
   at SourceTree.Repo.RepoHelper.CreatePullRequest(Repository repo, RepositoryRemoteProjectLink link, String remoteBranch, String commitSHA) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin\Repo\RepoHelper.cs:line 843
   at System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.InvokeClickAfterRender(Object arg)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
{quote}
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when creating pull request

   at MS.Win32.HwndWrapper.WndProc(IntPtr hwnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wParam, IntPtr lParam, Boolean& handled)
   at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.DispatcherCallbackOperation(Object o)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
}}
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashed

fields.description: If I have both staged and unstaged changes, I don't think there's any way for SourceTree to allow me to create a patch from my staged changes.  Every possible combination of things I try ends up showing the dreaded "No files selected, Please select at least one file" dialog.
fields.summary: Cannot create a patch if you have both staged and unstaged changes

fields.description:
Base info:
* i have existent mercurial repo.
* i'm staying on default branch
* i did some changes to existent code ( some files turn to "modified" )
TK:
1. create new branch
2. commit new changes via several commits.

Actual behavior: 
After creating new branch, if i will press commit - i will see list of *unchecked* modified files. If i'll press commit at this time - all *unchecked* files will be committed.

Expected behavior: dont commit unchecked files :)
fields.summary: Committing unchecked files

fields.description:
Non ASCII-characters are not saved correctly, when changing Commit message in the Interactive rebase-dialog.

"Lägger till stöd för Windows 10" is saved as "L?gger till st?d f?r Windows 10"
fields.summary: Interactive rebase: Message does not support Unicode

fields.description:
Steps taken:
1. created branch from Jira issue
2. added new remote repository to current repository
3. connected to new remote respository and searched for particular issue
4. copied commit of found issue
5. switched back to working branch
6. started terminal to cherry-pick commit from new remote repository
7. checked changes
8. commit changes
9. push changes to origin (working repository of current working branch)
10. create pull request from working branch
11. crash SourceTree with attached logfile

Restarting SourceTree and trying to 'create pull request' keeps giving the same error.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed on 'Create pull request' from existing branch
